design_philosophy.core_concept: MySpace 2000s Revival / Digital Brutalism / Y2K Chaos
design_philosophy.visual_style: Maximalist, Neon on Black, Pixelated, Glitchy
anti_patterns: No subtle gradients (use hard gradients or solid colors)

rules: Headings must be LARGE and PIXELATED
Mix serif and sans-serif for chaotic effect
Text shadows are mandatory for headings (e.g., neon glow)

layout.container_style: Fixed width 800px-1000px centered (optional) or Full Chaos
layout.z_index_strategy: Layered windows, popups on top of content

cards.style: Solid black background with neon border

marquee.usage: Mandatory for announcements and random thoughts

home.structure: Hero section with band logo (glitching), Marquee scrolling news, 'Enter Site' button (optional), chaotic collage of GIFs and stickers.

members.structure: Grid layout resembling MySpace 'Top 8'. Each member card has a pixelated photo and role.

discography.structure: List of albums with cover art (placeholder or generic vinyl/CD image) and Spotify play buttons.

merch.structure: Redirects to external shop, but show a teaser banner.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure neon text on black is readable (APCA check).

instructions_to_main_agent: 3. Create a 'Layout' component that includes the CRT scanline effect overlay (pointer-events-none).
4. Use 'border-2 border-green-500' (or pink/blue) for almost all containers.
5. Do not use standard Shadcn cards. Build raw divs with borders.
6. Implement the 'Marquee' component at the top or bottom of the screen.
7. Use the provided image URLs for backgrounds and textures to add depth.
8. Ensure all interactive elements have hover states that are aggressive (invert, glow, shake).
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable (or in this case, intentionally cramped for chaos).
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors.
All interactive elements MUST include data-testid attribute.
